Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town Conflict and Romantic Setup
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the initial conflicts in Ghost Town, focusing on the strained relationship between Nan and Cal and the impending threat to the town's existence due to the airport plan.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Argument and Cowboy's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the initial romantic conflict between the woman in green hat (Nan) and the cowboy (Cal) in Ghost Town, leading to the cowboy's frustrated departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town and Initial Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Airport Plan Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Surveyors arrive in Ghost Town and reveal their plan to build an airport, shocking the woman and the cowboy and introducing a town-level conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of Surveyors and the Airport Plan
Cowboy's Shock and the Impending Destruction of Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Romantic Misunderstanding and Parting
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal continue their fraught conversation, highlighting their romantic misunderstandings and culminating in Nan's departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Romantic Misunderstanding and Parting
Nan's Reflection on Love and Past Hurt

Major_Arcs.title: Shifting Tides and New Threats
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Nan's emotional journey, the introduction of new dangers in Ghost Town, and the escalating winter crisis that tests the community.

sub_scenes.title: Encounter with Rough Men and Businessmen's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Nan encounters rough men expressing discontent with 'progress', followed by her interaction with dismissive businessmen and her father's scolding.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of Rough Men and Discontent with 'Progress'
Businessmen Discuss Airport and Horses, Nan Interjects

sub_scenes.title: Consolation and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Nan is comforted by her mother and maid about Cal, leading to her resolve to confront him and a business discussion with her father.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother and Maid Console Nan About Cal

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Return and Winter Arrives
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal's disagreement and separation are followed by Cal's unexpected return and the onset of a harsh winter impacting Ghost Town.

sub_scenes.title: Winter Crisis and Community Hope
sub_scenes.description: The community reacts to the worsening snowstorm with worry, followed by a moment of comfort and then Cal's resolve to act, culminating in a reflection on the uncertain future.

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Intrigue and Jeff's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and shifts the focus to a new location and characters, particularly Jeff and his troubled relationship with his father's legacy.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Arrival and Town Gossip
sub_scenes.description: Despair over the snowfall turns to hope with the arrival of a plane dropping fodder, followed by Nan and Cal reflecting on romance, and the introduction of Chane Benson in a new town.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane and Fodder

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Sister's Concern
sub_scenes.description: The narrative delves into Jeff's past hero worship of his father, his sister's concern about his unhealthy obsession, and her confrontation with him about his behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Justifying Actions with Clyde Surrett's Example
Dismissing Chane Benson and Embracing Violence

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Clyde's Help and Benson's Menace
sub_scenes.description: The sister expresses her hopelessness about Jeff and seeks help from Clyde, while Chane Benson's menacing demeanor is further highlighted.

narrative_arcs.title: Expressing Fear and Seeking Help from Clyde
Declaration of Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Reassurance and Promise of Shared Happiness
Jeff's Disappearance and Pursuit to Town
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Seeking Advice
Chane Benson's Menacing Demeanor and Disdain for Young Boys

Major_Arcs.title: Benson's Threat and Editor's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the escalating conflict with Chane Benson, triggered by a newspaper article, and the editor's firm stance against Benson's threats.

sub_scenes.title: Article Repercussions and Benson's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Clyde discuss the article and Benson's threat, leading to Sally warning Clyde about Benson's cunning.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article and Benson's Threat
Warning about Benson's Cunning and Cowardice

sub_scenes.title: Editor's Resolve and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Sally seeks action from the editor, who decides to stay and fight Benson, followed by reflections on Clyde's resolve and the idea of inviting Benson to dinner.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Action from the Editor and Decision to Stay
Clyde's Unwavering Resolve and Benson's Character
Shifting Opinions and Dinner Invitation Idea

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Deception and Rising Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the deceptive dinner invitation to Benson, the events during the dinner, and the escalating conflict that erupts afterward, leading to a chase and rescue attempt.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner with Benson and Moonlight Charm
sub_scenes.description: The dinner with Benson takes place, marked by Jeff's excitement and a prevented 'demonstration', followed by a seemingly charming moonlight interaction between Chane and Sally.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Forced Affection
sub_scenes.description: The moonlight charm quickly dissipates into confrontation as Jeff accuses Sally, Chane intervenes, and the tension culminates in a forced kiss and Sally's angry rebuke.

sub_scenes.title: Fight and Rescue Race
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Chane's verbal altercation escalates into a physical fight, followed by Sally's warning about Clyde's danger and Jeff's race to rescue him.

narrative_arcs.title: Fight, Warning, and Race to Rescue Clyde

Major_Arcs.title: Capture, Clarion Office, and Newspaper's Role
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with Clyde's capture by Benson, a flashback to tension at the Clarion office, and the newspaper staff's determination to continue their work despite the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Jeff arrives to witness Clyde's capture by Chane Benson and his men, leading to Clyde's apprehension.

sub_scenes.title: Clarion Office Flashback and Headline Change
sub_scenes.description: A flashback to the Clarion office reveals past tensions, followed by Sally's nervous request to Jeff to manipulate the headline about Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Post-Capture Planning and Newspaper's Courage
sub_scenes.description: Despite Clyde's capture, the Clarion staff works through the night to produce the next edition, emphasizing courage and decency in their work.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Setting and Betsy's Introduction
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new ranch setting and characters, Betsy and Steve, exploring ranch troubles, initial interactions, and building romantic tension.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve Daley's Intro
sub_scenes.description: A ranch confrontation is interrupted by the introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy, setting up new character dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Management and Bunk Assignment
sub_scenes.description: Discussions about ranch management and Steve's performance are followed by Betsy showing Steve to his bunk, initiating personal interaction.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Troubles and Buckboard Ride
sub_scenes.description: Hank defends hiring Steve while Betsy reveals past connection, followed by discussion of ranch problems and a buckboard ride for Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Slap Fight
sub_scenes.description: Hank gives orders, followed by Betsy and Steve arriving in town, leading to town gossip and a slap fight initiated by Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Bodyguard Confirmed and Hank's Plea
sub_scenes.description: Betsy confirms Steve as her bodyguard, followed by Hank's plea to keep his job and Betsy's reassurance.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Job Secured and Gratitude Expressed

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Bridges' Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets conditions for Steve's job regarding guns, leading to a romantic confession and embrace, interrupted by news of Bridges' arrival.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification and Choice about Gunfighter Role
Betsy's Change of Heart and Plea to Stay

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass and Violent Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc culminates in a violent confrontation at Devil's Pass, Betsy getting shot, and the aftermath leading to a romantic resolution for Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation with Bridges and Threats
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation with Old Man Bridges escalates with threats and gun display, interpreted by observers as a declaration of war.

narrative_arcs.title: Analysis of the Confrontation as a Declaration of War
Betsy's Assertion of Authority and Gun Ownership

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Hank's Fate
sub_scenes.description: Steve reflects and recalls a flashback to Hank's ambush and death, adding context to the ongoing conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Reflection, Flashback to Ambush, and Hank's Fate

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Departure and Betsy's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Steve decides to leave for Devil's Pass, despite Betsy's pleas, leading to Betsy's contemplation and decision to follow him.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Betsy Shot
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at Devil's Pass leads to a tense confrontation and Betsy's dramatic shooting.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Survival, Reunion and Romantic Future
sub_scenes.description: Betsy survives the shooting, leading to a heartfelt reunion with Steve and reaffirmation of their romantic future.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Survival and Reunion with Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Love Triangle Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex relationships between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, exploring jealousy, misunderstanding, and ultimately Carrie's choice and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dave and Carrie - Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: A new scene introduces conflict related to 'Dave', possibly setting up a love triangle or relationship tension.

sub_scenes.title: Curley and Ranch Issues
sub_scenes.description: Curley's unexpected actions in the corral are juxtaposed with news of trouble with new ranch buyers, introducing external ranch conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Trouble with Bar Fenin Ranch Buyers

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: A fence dispute escalates into a confrontation led by Fred Gordon, culminating in a gunfight and forceful resolution by the older man.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussing the Fence and Range Issues
Fred Gordon's Confrontation at the Fence

sub_scenes.title: Apology and Intimate Conversation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie apologizes to Dave, leading to reconciliation and an intimate conversation reflecting on Fred and their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Intimate Conversation and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Reappearance and Accusation
sub_scenes.description: Fred Gordon unexpectedly reappears, disrupting the peace and leading to Carrie's confrontation and private conversation with Dave.

sub_scenes.title: Proposal and Carlton Contract
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on past misunderstandings, leading to a marriage proposal from Dave, quickly followed by Carrie discussing the Carlton contract with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Past Misunderstandings and Romantic Resolution

sub_scenes.title: Accusation and Determined Action
sub_scenes.description: Carrie angrily accuses Dave of trickery, leading to her determination to act against Fred and seek out Mr. Carlton.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Inquiry with Dave and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office and Father's Comfort
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Fred arrive at Carlton's office, where Carrie confronts Fred, followed by a conversation with Mr. Carlton and emotional comfort from her father.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Interruption at Carlton's Office
Carlton's Business History and Carrie's Resolution

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Independence
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Fred, declaring her victory and independence, followed by an encounter with Dave and a question about her feelings for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of Independence and Western Identity
Anger, Apology, and Question of Love

sub_scenes.title: Confession and Father's Wisdom
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confesses her love for Fred to Dave, followed by reflection on her father's wisdom and Dave's skeptical reaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom and Long Ride Home
Accusation of Heartbreak and Eastern Trickery

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Love Confirmed
sub_scenes.description: News of Fred's sacrifice leads to Carrie's reunion with Fred and a heartfelt confirmation of their love and commitment.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Dave's Words and Embracing Love

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance Chase and Final Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Dirk's desperate escape and Rance's relentless pursuit, culminating in a violent confrontation and a final romantic resolution for Chris and Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Plea and True Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk seeks refuge with Chris, downplaying his injury, but a doctor reveals the severity of his gunshot wound.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation Plan and Forced Search
sub_scenes.description: An older man plans to investigate Dirk's situation, leading to Chris Ransom's arrival at a ranch and a forced search for evidence.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Search and Blood Stained Pinto

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Duty
sub_scenes.description: A confrontation about Dirk's actions ensues, with law asserting duty and a friend arguing for Dirk's safety.

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Resignation
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and a woman reunite, sharing a moment of despair and resignation about their situation.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Mutual Declaration
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses her love to Rance, leading to a mutual declaration and embrace.

sub_scenes.title: Duty vs Love and Planning the Chase
sub_scenes.description: Rance balances duty with newfound love, planning a chase after Dirk with Chris's help.

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Pursuit Realization
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris escape, quickly realizing they are being relentlessly pursued by Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Relentless Pursuit and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Rance's relentless pursuit culminates in a face-to-face confrontation with Dirk, escalating into a shooting.

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: The immediate aftermath of the shooting involves a moral dilemma about the wounded person's fate.

sub_scenes.title: Departure, Love and Return
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris depart, but Chris's love for Rance compels her to return, while Dirk escapes to Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: The Difficult Departure and Lingering Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Recovery and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers, leading to a heartfelt reunion with Chris, mutual confessions of love, and a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Mutual Feelings and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Dirk's Fate
sub_scenes.description: On their wedding day, Chris and Rance discuss Dirk, who then dramatically appears, leading to a final resolution and the Marshal's perspective on Dirk's fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Chris's Concern and Rance's Reassurance about Dirk
The Marshal's Appreciation and Wedding Gift
